byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

abstract: City of Ferguson, Mo, has, in year since fatal shooting of Michael Brown, taken steps to address racial inequities but progress has been slow; gains are undeniable but many measures like replacement of judges and police officials are only temporary; community is divided between those who view changes as superficial and those who believe actual progress is being made.
lead_paragraph: The mostly black town where Michael Brown died is divided between those who think reforms are significant, and those who see them as merely superficial.

headline.main: A Year Later, Ferguson Sees Change, but Asks if It’s Real
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Sees Change, but Asks if It’s Real

snippet: The mostly black town where Michael Brown died is divided between those who think reforms are significant, and those who see them as merely superficial.
